item.title: Sabina Nessa: Hundreds pay respects at London vigil
item.description: The vigil at Pegler Square is not far from where a wanted suspect was captured on CCTV.

item.title: Life sentence for Bristol man who murdered baby son
item.description: James Clark, 31, was convicted of killing baby Sean who died with 71 rib fractures and head injuries.

item.title: Olly Stephens: Three teenagers detained over boy's stabbing death
item.description: Olly Stephens, 13, was ambushed by two boys after being lured to a field by a girl in Reading.

item.title: Birmingham Pride: Cheryl pulls out over Harding grief
item.description: The singer says she is not emotionally able to perform after her ex-band mate's death.

item.title: Human trafficking ring gang members jailed
item.description: One man earned Â£900,000 in two years by exploiting the workers and skimming off their wages.

item.title: Annabel Wright death: Family calls for ban on acne drug for teenagers
item.description: Annabel Wright, 15, had been using Roaccutane in the months before she died.

item.title: Solihull councillor quits role over autism comments
item.description: Conservative councillor Angela Sandison steps down after criticism from parents and politicians.

item.title: Port of Dover: Arrests made as Insulate Britain blocks port
item.description: Queues form at Europe's busiest ferry terminal as Insulate Britain shift their protest from the M25.

item.title: Blackpool Illuminations face Native American racism claims
item.description: Two people of "Native American origin" complained to Blackpool Council about the tableau.

item.title: Chef facing deportation a victim of mistakes
item.description: Saiful Islam has been in the UK since 2003 but a mix up led to him being mistaken for sex offender.

item.title: Margaret Keenan: First UK person to get the Pfizer jab gets booster
item.description: The 91-year-old got her booster in Coventry alongside the matron who administered her first dose.

item.title: Warning after Lewes girl, 6, has surgery for swallowing magnets
item.description: The girl had swallowed 23 strong magnets, which ripped through her bowel.

item.title: Extinction Rebellion: Paralympian James Brown jailed for plane glue stunt
item.description: Ex-Paralympic champion James Brown climbed on to a British Airways plane at London City Airport.

item.title: Middlesbrough couple stuck in Kabul fear giving in to Taliban
item.description: Ahmed, who lives in Middlesbrough, was visiting family when his flight from Kabul was cancelled.

item.title: Ric Pallister: former council leader jailed for indecent assaults
item.description: Ric Pallister, ex-leader of South Somerset District Council, has been jailed for 11 years.

item.title: Ingoldmells caravan fire: Inquest into toddler death opens
item.description: Louisiana-Brooke Dolan is thought to have died from the effects of smoke inhalation, an inquest hears.

item.title: Petrol driver shortage: Ministers discuss supply issues
item.description: Ministers focused on the impact of the lorry driver shortage, with fuel the latest sector to be affected.

item.title: Killamarsh: Man in crown court charged with murders of children and woman
item.description: Damien Bendall is accused of killing Terri Harris and three children at a house in Derbyshire.

item.title: Covid in Cumbria: Siblings of positive children told to isolate
item.description: The move brought in by Cumbria health bosses goes against national guidelines over isolation.

item.title: Vicky Glass murder: Police to reinvestigate 21-year-old case
item.description: Vicky Glass's body was found six weeks after she disappeared in 2000, but no-one has been caught.

item.title: Birmingham hospital worker stole QE patient's bank cards
item.description: Hospital worker Rebecca Ellis also goes on a Dorothy Perkins spending spree using the dying man's funds.

item.title: Northumberland diver finds seal with ring stuck round neck
item.description: A seal is found swimming off the Northumberland coast with a rubber ring stuck around its neck.

item.title: Organ donor honoured by hospital after helping eight people
item.description: When Karen Piotrâs husband died suddenly, his decision to be an organ donor saved other lives.

item.title: Homeless in London: 'People pretend they are not there'
item.description: Photographer Anthony Dawton has been documenting London's homeless population during the pandemic.

item.title: Social prescribing: How a community garden helps combat isolation
item.description: Sara Lee says she has "come out of her shell" after being referred to Blackpool Community Farm.

item.title: The Cumbrian walking group going strong after 20 years
item.description: The weekly group in Cumbria was set up in 1998 for former bank colleagues to stay in contact.

item.title: Burnley man denies Marks & Spencer terror attack murder attempt
item.description: A Burnley man tells a court he "did not attempt to murder" two women in a Marks & Spencer store.

item.title: HS2 not ready before 2041, MP Andrew Bridgen claims in Commons
item.description: Backbencher Andrew Bridgen says a whistleblower predicts the project will be delayed by a decade.

item.title: Seven out of 10 win benefits challenges at tribunal
item.description: More than 287,000 people in three years overturn initial government decision.

item.title: Corrie Mckeague: Credible leads needed in RAF airman probe - police
item.description: A body has never been found since Corrie Mckeague disappeared on a night out five years ago.

item.title: Sickle cell disease: Patient's 'excruciating' wait for pain drugs
item.description: John Griffiths says hospital staff in Kent routinely fail to provide the medication he needs.

item.title: Freshers Week: Organised criminals targeting universities
item.description: A drugs charity boss said the best safety advice was not to take the drugs in the first place.

item.title: Mondelez threatens trademark battle over bar's lilac packaging
item.description: Mondelez believes Primal Pantry's vegan fruit bar "exploits" the trademark of its Milka chocolates.

item.title: Warwickshire beat Somerset to win County Championship
item.description: Warwickshire beat Somerset at Edgbaston to win their first County Championship title in nine years.

item.title: Emma Raducanu: British number one splits with coach after US Open win
item.description: British number one Emma Raducanu splits with the coach who helped guide her to a first Grand Slam title at the US Open.

item.title: Super League: Warrington Wolves 0-19 Hull KR - Robins set up a semi-final at Catalans
item.description: Hull KR stun Warrington to set up a Super League semi-final at Catalans Dragons, only a year after finishing bottom of the table.
